main.name: Aritra Roy
main.bio: Hi...Aritra here. I've just completed my M.Sc. Chemistry degree from Pondicherry Central University, India. I'm mainly interested in Chemical Information Science (mainly known as Computational Chemistry) & Bonding Analysis. I love studying reasearch articles and implementing those concepts in my work. Also, I love teaching, whether it is junior or fellow-student. It is lovely to engage people around me in chemistry by relating as much as possible to everyday life through questioning and experiential way. Also, I'm seeking to learn new part of theoretical studies like Molecular Docking, Virtual Screening, MD Simulation etc.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me to receive further details, get coached or anything else.

resume.skillmessage: I'm very much interested in theroatical research on various physical and chemical aspects of material science chemistry.

work.title: Theoretical Chemist
work.description1: Have knowledge of Spartan' 14, Gaussian 09W, GaussView 5.0, WinCACAO, Materials Studio Softwares.
work.description2: Studied about Basis Set, PES, Semi-emperical Method and DFT and use B3LYP, PBE-GGA etc. functions along with Gaussian and CASTEP modules.
work.description3: Completed a course on - 'Nanotechnology and Nanosensors, Part1' on Coursera.
work.description4: Completed a course on - 'Fundamentals of Macroscopic and Microscopic Thermodynamics' on Coursera.

work.title: Intermediate Programmer
work.description1: Completed Python Programming under WB Govt. (Regd. No. - S/IL/47623) with Grade: A (90%-100%) on 21/12/2020.
work.description2: Completed Java Programming under WB Govt. (Regd. No. - S/IL/47623) with Grade: B (80%-90%) on 20/12/2019.
work.description3: Completed C Programming under WB Govt. (Regd. No. - S/IL/47623) with Grade: B (80%-90%) on 20/12/2019.
work.description4: Completed Basic Course on Computer under WB Govt. (Regd. No. - S/IL/47623) with Grade: A (90%-100%) on 20/12/2019.
work.description5: Have the intermediate level knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React and Redux.

testimonials.text: A keen guy, aware of the advancement in 'Theoretical Chemistry'. Enthusiastic hard worker and a beginner in programming. Hope to see you at a good position in life. Best Regards G. Jhaa
testimonials.user: Gaurav Jhaa, PHD Scholar at Pondicherry University, India (Mentor)

testimonials.text: One of the most dedicated, disciplined and focused person, I have ever seen. He is a good student and a good teacher also. We have spent 3 years in our college and I have learned a lots of things about the computational and theoretical chemistry from him. He does the chemistry very well in both the field, theoretical and practical. He has a keen focused mindset to be a theoretician. On the other hand he has a very strong knowledge in computational algorithms. I will sincerely recommend him to in the field of theoretical chemical research.
testimonials.user: Tarak Nath Das, Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research, India (Worked in same group)

testimonials.text: He is one of the most disciplined, hardworking and dedicated persons I have ever come across. He has very keen interest in the field of computational chemistry and for that he even started learning different type of programming and coding languages from scratches and within few months he has become quite adept in this field. His perseverance is on different level. I have learnt and have been learning different qualities constantly since I have met him.
testimonials.user: Abhijit Chail, Pondicherry University, India (Worked in same group)
